title: ISic003548. An antiquarian 'forgery'
body:
1θεοῖς πᾶσι
2Δρεπαναί[ων]
3πόλεως σοτῆρσιν
4<τραπέζαν> καὶ τὸν βωμὸν
5Λ(ούκιος) Μάλιος[. 5.]
6χιλιάρχησα[ς ..]
7Π(- - -) Π(- - -)

l.3 reg., orig. σοτῆρσιν | l.4 τραπέζαν

1ΘΕΟΙΣΠΑΣΙ
2ΔΡΕΠΑΝΑΙ[..]
3ΠΟΛΕΩΣΣΟΤΗΡΣΙΝ
4ΠΡΑΠΕΤΑΚΑΙΤΟΝΒΩΜΟΝ
5ΛΜΑΛΙΟΣ[·····]
6ΧΙΛΙΑΡΧΗΣΑ[.··]
7ΠΠ

l.3 reg., orig. σοτῆρσιν | l.4 τραπέζαν

Facsimile Images

Apparatus criticus

  • Text after comparison of Kaibel, Filippi and SEG, prioritising Kaibel's transcription of the manuscript tradition;
  • 4: Kaibel reports ΤΩΝ with Ο marked above the Ω
  • 7: ΠΠ: perhaps for p(ecunia) p(osuit) or p(ropria) p(ecunia) (so Tybout, ap. SEG)

English translation

Giorgia Capra

To all the Saviour Deities of the city of Drepanon. Lucius Malios, chiliarch, dedicated a table and a pedestal with his own money.

commentary

As Korhonen lucidly details, the inscription is one of a series of late 18th century local antiquarian forgeries, constructed on the basis of existing texts, principally those to be found in the 1769 first edition of the corpus of Torremuzza. Kaibel classed the entire series already as forgeries in IG XIV.

bibliography

  • 14.0024* https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10001072
  • 52.0893 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10000796
  • Filippi 2002 73 no.9/1 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10001991
  • Filippi 2005 66 no. 9/1 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10002296
  • Korhonen 2017 198 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10001484
Licensed under a Creative Commons-Attribution 4.0 licence.
